column1: Pik Talgar (Kazakh: Талғар шыңы Talǵar shyńy; Russian: Пик Талгар
column2: romanized: Pik Talgar) is a northern peak in the Tian Shan mountain range in Kazakhstan
column3: named after Talgar river and city. It is the highest peak of the Trans-Ili Alatau. Due to its close proximity to the former capital of Kazakhstan
column5: it is a popular mountaineering destination. Sources differ on Pik Talgar's elevation
